posts.post_content: I think this has been over-mentioned, but: Persist Creatures. It's an uncounterable method of "healing" your persist creatures. It's also better than Novijen since it has a cheaper activation cost, is limited to only green creatures (so it's less likely to help out your opponent if you need to activate this during their turn), and gives colored mana (green, which matches with its 2nd ability). The fact that it comes into play tapped is not that big of a deal considering the advantages I just listed.
posts.html:
I think this has been over-mentioned, but: Persist Creatures. It's an uncounterable method of "healing" your persist creatures. It's also better than Novijen since it has a cheaper activation cost, is limited to only green creatures (so it's less likely to help out your opponent if you need to activate this during their turn), and gives colored mana (green, which matches with its 2nd ability). The fact that it comes into play tapped is not that big of a deal considering the advantages I just listed.

posts.post_content: Works very well if you have extra mana when casting [Putrid Leech](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrid Leech), [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf), [Kitchen Finks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kitchen Finks), or [Great Sable Stag](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Great Sable Stag). Coming into play tapped slows it a bit or it would be 4x autoinclude in any deck including even one green creature and one forest.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: unless I am drawing a blank on a rules change, +1/+1 counters and -1/-1 counters cancel each other out, this is why finks and ajani goldmane go so well together, play finks, get 2 life, block, get 2 life, ajani pumps and you repeat until opponent kills ajani or you win

posts.post_content: The reason why persist creatures don't die is because their toughness is still high enough to do persist, they still have all -1/-1 counters and all +1/+1 counters on them.
posts.html:
The reason why persist creatures don't die is because their toughness is still high enough to do persist, they still have all -1/-1 counters and all +1/+1 counters on them.
